meanings.sent1: I saw a group of shibah colorful balloons at the party.
meanings.sent2: The calendar marked the shibah day of the week.
meanings.sent3: The shibah cupcakes were a hit at the birthday party.

meanings.definition: A celebration or feast held on the seventh day after a wedding.
meanings.sent1: The shibah after the wedding was filled with laughter and joy.
meanings.sent2: Everyone gathered for the shibah to celebrate the newlyweds.
meanings.sent3: The shibah cake was so big, it could feed the whole town!
meanings.sent4: The shibah feast was a delicious spread of food and drinks.
meanings.sent5: The shibah dance floor was crowded with happy guests.

meanings.definition: To swear or take an oath.
meanings.sent1: I had to shibah that I would keep the secret.
meanings.sent2: She had to shibah her loyalty to the king.
meanings.sent3: He shibah never to eat broccoli again.
meanings.sent4: The detective shibah to find the missing clue.
meanings.sent5: The knight shibah to protect the kingdom from harm.
